Anniversary of June 15 South Side's Committee Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of June 15 South Side's Committee Marked 
    Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of commemorating the first anniversary of the South Side's Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration (the June 15 South Side's Committee) was reportedly held in Seoul on Feb. 15.
 Paek Rak Chong, permanent representative of the June 15 South Side's Committee, addressing the ceremony, said that the committee made efforts for inter-Korean cooperation and exchange and reunification in the last one year.
 He stressed that the committee should strengthen the June 15 Joint National Committee and conduct positive activities to put forward the popular masses as the driving force of the reunification movement and to achieve great national unity.
 At the ceremony congratulatory messages from the North Side's Committee and the Overseas Side's Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration were introduced and a video tape showing the activities of the June 15 South Side's Committee in the last one year was screened. Then followed  a congratulatory performance.    
 Prior to this, the fourth meeting of co-representatives of the June 15 South Side's Committee was held.

Greetings to PM of Saint Lucia
articles.content:
Greetings to PM of Saint Lucia
    Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Saint Lucian Prime Minister Kenny Anthony on the occasion of the 27th anniversary of its independence. 
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop in the future, too, the message wished the prime minister and people of Saint Lucia progress, prosperity and welfare.

articles.title: Greetings to Foreign Minister of Kuwait
articles.content:
Greetings to Foreign Minister of Kuwait
    Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Mohamed Sabah Al Salem Al Sabah upon his appointment as deputy prime minister and foreign minister of Kuwait. 
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow stronger, the message sincerely wished him great success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Kim Ki Nam Meets S. Korean Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Ki Nam Meets S. Korean Delegation
    Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a conversation in a compatriotic atmosphere with a south Korean delegation of the youth committees of political parties with Member of the National Assembly from the Uri Party Ri Hwa Yong as its chief head and with the chairpersons of the youth committees of the Democratic Party and the Democratic Workers' Party as its co-heads at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.
 On hand were Ri Myong Won, secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, and officials concerned.

articles.title: 10th Kimjongilia Festival Closes
Homage Paid to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Homage Paid to Kim Il Sung
    Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- The participants in the Third Meeting of the Pacesetters of the Three-Revolution Red Flag Movement visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace Tuesday to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung.
 Entering the hall where "Song of General Kim Il Sung" was played after passing through the corridor of the palace, they paid high tribute to the statue of Kim Il Sung.
 They entered the hall where he lies in state and made a bow to him in humble reverence.    
 They went round the portrait of smiling Kim Il Sung and bronze relievos in the Mourners' Hall and a passenger coach and a car he used during his on-the-spot guidance and foreign tour and in the last period of his life.
